intro: Senecio microcephalus var. angustifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaf Senecio, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It features small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
